item.description:
Its Spring time and that means its time to get back out on the Appalachian Trail! After finishing the 90 miles of Massachusetts last year, we'll start working on Connecticut's 52 miles. Just as with Mass, we'll go from South to North. We'll hike from the New York/Connecticut border on Hoyt rd near Wingdale, CT to route 31 in Kent, CT. This section is 11.5 miles and offers some great views and scenery.  I'm estimating it will take us around 8 hours to complete.

 

We'll meet at the trailhead on CT 341 (Macedonia rd) in Kent, CT, which is the ending spot of our hike. We'll leave half the cars here and head down to the trail head on Hoyt rd.

 

For more detailed information on the hike, please see:

Trail Description

 

Is This Hike for Me?

This is a lengthy hike with a lot of elevation change....not all at once, but a lot of up and down, and it adds up. We will have ascents of 1000 feet, 500 feet, and several shorter. We'll be moving at a moderate pace. Please have done something of similar length before signing up. Please bring plenty of water (I'm bringing 3 liters) appropriate hiking attire (no jeans or cotton, hiking boots not sneakers), rain gear in case the weather turns nasty, lunch, and snacks.


Trailhead Directions:

From Providence about 3 hours

There is parking right along the road at the trail head.

Google Map:
Google Maps Link

Coordinates: 41.731029, -73.490691

 

Connecticut Section Map


Carpool Option:

Please use the comments section to coordinate with other hikers if you want to carpool. Keep in mind that car spotting is involved!


Liability Waiver:
As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

item.name: Connecticut Appalachian Trail: Part 1
